pageContext.claim: “The other thing, they want to be able to drag out the election long beyond the 3rd. Well, in all fairness this is a very important place, right, and we can't drag it out. We don't want to drag out any longer, so we are in lots of court having to do with this and having to do with many states, about five of them. And so far, we've had a lot of good victories, and we'll continue because we're not going to let this election be taken away from us. That's the only way they're going to win it.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump baselessly lays the groundwork for his post-election claims of fraud in the Keystone State. He is complaining that officials were given extra time to count mail-in ballots, offering no evidence that the Democrats are trying to steal the election. After Trump lost to Biden, courts threw out his claims of nefarious doings in the night.
